page.title: 07HOUSING HINTON-ON-THE-GREEN
page.content: {HOUSING AFTER 1940}- A survey of modern houses built after 1940 in Hinton on the Green revealed 22 council houses and 12 old age pension houses. 10 council houses have been sold. 5 privately owned houses were built in 1978. All the houses are of brick construction under tiled roofs.All have modern conveniences.Each has a fair sized front and rear garden. {FARMS}- Of the 4 farm houses built about 200 years ago 1 is red brick, 2 cotswold stone and 1 grey stone.The roof materials are tiles. One of the farms had original wattle and daub which was discovered during present alterations.All have inside bathrooms. Two houses have extensions. 2 farms have central heating. The farms are rented from Laslett's charity.
